category-description: Available in a range of vivid hues, synthetic spinel is a versatile and affordable choice for collectors and cutters.
product-description:
Synthetic Spinel

Synthetic spinel is a vibrant and durable lab-created gemstone valued for its rich colours, excellent clarity, and versatility in faceting. Produced through controlled crystal growth methods, it comes in a wide spectrum of hues including deep blues, rich reds, soft pinks, and vivid greens. These bright, consistent colours, combined with a glassy lustre and high transparency, make synthetic spinel a favourite for both jewellery design and gem collections.

Unlike many natural stones, synthetic spinel is typically free from inclusions and zoning, allowing it to be cut into striking gemstones with clean lines and high polish. Its hardness and stability also make it well-suited for detailed lapidary work and display. Though man-made, each piece reflects the same crystal structure as natural spinel, offering beauty and brilliance without the limitations of natural supply.

Ideal for gem cutters, collectors, and creative makers, synthetic spinel combines the aesthetic appeal of fine gemstones with the consistency and accessibility of modern synthesis. Whether showcased in its raw form or transformed into a faceted gem, it provides a striking and dependable option for a variety of uses.

PropertyValue
Chemical FormulaMgAl2O4
Mohs Hardness8
ClarityEye Clear
Refractive Index (RI)1.72- 1.74

Disclaimer:

Although these stones have been grown to be consistent, some variations in colour, shape, and inclusions may occur. Please note that photos are taken under lighting conditions that best showcase the stone’s features. Colours may vary slightly depending on lighting and screen settings.

category-description: Durable and brilliantly coloured, our synthetic sapphires are ideal for precision faceting and jewellery work.
product-description:
Synthetic Sapphire

Synthetic sapphire is a highly durable and optically appealing material widely used in jewellery and industrial applications. Known for its exceptional hardness and high refractive index, it is a favourite among gem cutters for faceting. Lab-created through flame fusion, synthetic sapphire closely mimics its natural counterpart in structure and beauty, while offering consistency and affordability.

PropertyValue
Chemical FormulaAl2O3
Mohs Hardness9
ClarityEye Clean
Refractive Index (RI)1.76 - 1.77

Disclaimer:

Although these stones have been grown to be consistent, some variations in colour, shape, and inclusions may occur. Please note that photos are taken under lighting conditions that best showcase the stone’s features. Colours may vary slightly depending on lighting and screen settings.

category-description: With high brilliance and diamond-like sparkle, synthetic cubic zirconia is perfect for eye-catching faceting projects.
product-description:
Synthetic Cubic Zirconia

Synthetic cubic zirconia is a highly regarded man-made gemstone known for its exceptional brilliance, clarity, and diamond-like sparkle. Grown in laboratory conditions, it offers a consistently flawless structure and an impressive range of colours, from clear and icy whites to vibrant reds, blues, greens, and more. Its strong dispersion gives it intense fire under light, making it a popular and affordable alternative to diamonds in jewellery and design.

Though created rather than mined, cubic zirconia shares many of the visual qualities that gemstone enthusiasts admire. Its high refractive index, hardness, and flawless appearance make it an ideal choice for cutting and faceting. Each piece is the result of careful and controlled crystal growth, allowing for a level of precision and uniformity rarely found in nature.

Perfect for collectors, craftspeople, and those seeking striking visual appeal, synthetic cubic zirconia offers both beauty and versatility. Whether displayed as a dazzling crystal or used in fine jewellery, it delivers the brilliance of precious stones with the reliability of modern technology.

PropertyValue
Chemical FormulaZrO2 + stabilisers (e.g. Y2O3)
Mohs Hardness8.5
ClarityEye Clean
Refractive Index (RI)2.15 - 2.18

Disclaimer:

Although these stones have been grown to be consistent, some variations in colour, shape, and inclusions may occur. Please note that photos are taken under lighting conditions that best showcase the stone’s features. Colours may vary slightly depending on lighting and screen settings.

category-description: Known for its brilliance and fire, natural zircon is a striking gemstone with rich tones and ancient origins
product-description:
Natural Zircon

Natural zircon is a striking mineral known for its brilliance, density, and rich variety of colours ranging from earthy browns and reds to golden yellows and vibrant blues. In its rough form, zircon often displays sharp crystal faces, glassy lustre, and natural zoning that make it a favourite among collectors and mineral lovers. Its notable double refraction can sometimes be seen even without cutting, offering a fascinating look into the stone’s optical properties.

Though rough zircon crystals are beautiful in their own right, they are also highly valued for faceting. When cut, zircon reveals intense fire and sparkle, sometimes rivaling that of diamonds. Blue zircons are especially sought after in the jewellery world, though natural colours are appreciated for their character and earthy depth. Each stone, whether raw or polished, carries the legacy of ancient geological processes and is often billions of years old.

Ideal for both collectors and lapidary enthusiasts, zircon offers a unique combination of aesthetic appeal and scientific significance. Its natural imperfections, inclusions, and colour zoning give each specimen an individual charm that reflects its dramatic journey through the Earth’s crust.

PropertyValue
Chemical FormulaZrSiO4
Mohs Hardness6 - 7.5
Refractive Index (RI)1.92 - 2.01
OriginHarts Ranges, Northern Territory

Disclaimer:

Due to the natural origin of each stone, expect some variations in colour, shape, and inclusions. Please note that photos are taken under lighting conditions that best showcase the stone’s features. Colours may vary slightly depending on lighting and screen settings. Natural imperfections and variations are typical and contribute to the authenticity of the specimen.

category-description: Explore the timeless beauty of natural sapphires, prized for their vivid colours and exceptional durability.
product-description:
Natural Sapphire

Natural sapphires are highly valued gemstones known for their exceptional durability, vibrant colours, and rich geological origins. Typically found in blues but also available in a range of colours, they are ideal for faceting, cabbing, or collecting. Their natural inclusions and variations make each sapphire unique and desirable for both lapidary and jewellery use.

PropertyValue
Chemical FormulaAl2O3
Mohs Hardness9
ClarityVaries – Often Included
Refractive Index (RI)1.76 - 1.77

Disclaimer:

Due to the natural origin of each stone, expect some variations in colour, shape, and inclusions. Please note that photos are taken under lighting conditions that best showcase the stone’s features. Colours may vary slightly depending on lighting and screen settings.

category-description: Known for its brilliance and fire, natural zircon is a striking gemstone with rich tones and ancient origins
product-description:
Natural Garnet

Natural garnets are bold, deep-coloured gemstones with excellent hardness and a rich lapidary history. Typically found in reds and burgundies, garnets can also appear in greens, oranges, and other hues. Their consistent structure and vibrant colours make them perfect for faceting and cabbing alike.

PropertyValue
Chemical FormulaX3Y2(SiO4)3 (varies by type)
Mohs Hardness6.5 – 7.5
ClarityVaries – Generally Eye Clean to Moderately Included
Refractive Index (RI)1.73 – 1.89

Disclaimer:

Due to the natural origin of each stone, expect some variations in colour, shape, and inclusions. Please note that photos are taken under lighting conditions that best showcase the stone’s features. Colours may vary slightly depending on lighting and screen settings.

category-description: Known for its brilliance and fire, natural zircon is a striking gemstone with rich tones and ancient origins
product-description:
Natural Tourmaline

Tourmaline is a beloved and colourful mineral group prized by gem cutters and collectors. Known for its incredible range of colours – from greens and pinks to bicolour and even black – tourmaline is a relatively hard and stable stone for faceting and cabbing. It is particularly favoured for its pleochroism and unique internal character.

PropertyValue
Chemical FormulaComplex Borosilicate (varies by variety)
Mohs Hardness7 – 7.5
ClarityVaries – Often Included
Refractive Index (RI)1.61 – 1.66

Disclaimer:

Due to the natural origin of each stone, expect some variations in colour, shape, and inclusions. Please note that photos are taken under lighting conditions that best showcase the stone’s features. Colours may vary slightly depending on lighting and screen settings.

category-description: Apatite is a vibrant phosphate mineral prized for its striking blue and green hues, although it can occur in a range of colours
product-description:
Natural Apatite

Natural apatite is a vibrant and colourful mineral that occurs in shades of neon blue, green, yellow, and even violet. Known for its striking transparency and vivid hues, apatite is a favourite among collectors and lapidary enthusiasts alike. In its natural, uncut state, apatite often forms elongated hexagonal crystals with a glassy lustre, making it visually appealing even before any faceting or polishing is done.

Though somewhat soft compared to other gemstones, apatite can be faceted into brilliant gems that display impressive sparkle and saturation. Its delicate structure requires care during cutting, but the results are often stunning—especially in the highly prized electric-blue and sea-green varieties. Because of its vibrant appearance, apatite is often used in artistic jewellery and statement pieces that highlight the stone’s natural beauty.

Beyond aesthetics, apatite has geological and biological significance—it plays a major role in the formation of bones and teeth in vertebrates and is a key component in phosphate-rich rocks. Whether valued for its scientific importance or captivating colour, natural apatite offers a unique and multifaceted appeal to those interested in both beauty and Earth’s processes.

PropertyValue
Chemical FormulaCa5(PO4)3(F,Cl,OH)
Mohs Hardness5
Refractive Index (RI)1.63 - 1.65
OriginHarts Ranges, Northern Territory

Disclaimer:

Due to the natural origin of each stone, expect some variations in colour, shape, and inclusions. Please note that photos are taken under lighting conditions that best showcase the stone’s features. Colours may vary slightly depending on lighting and screen settings.

category-description: From Amethyst to Smoky, from Rose to Citrine, Quartz is a highly versatile crystal with lots of potential
product-description:
Natural Quartz

Quartz is a captivating mineral celebrated for its clarity, range of colours, and varied crystal forms. From the deep purples of amethyst to the smoky browns and greys of smoky quartz, this mineral also includes varieties like citrine with its warm golden hues. In its natural state, quartz often displays well-defined crystal faces and a vitreous lustre that appeals to collectors and crystal enthusiasts alike.

While quartz is admired in its raw form, it is also prized for its versatility in jewellery and decorative arts. The different colours and qualities of quartz can evoke a variety of moods, from the calming translucence of amethyst to the grounding tones of smoky quartz. Each piece carries the story of ancient geological formation, often millions of years in the making, reflecting the unique conditions under which it formed.

Popular with collectors, artisans, and those interested in the natural world, quartz combines beauty with durability. Its natural variations, including inclusions and colour zoning, add to the individual character of each specimen, making quartz a timeless mineral that continues to inspire fascination and creativity.

PropertyValue
Chemical FormulaSiO2
Mohs Hardness7
Refractive Index (RI)1.54 - 1.55

Disclaimer:

Due to the natural origin of each stone, expect some variations in colour, shape, and inclusions. Please note that photos are taken under lighting conditions that best showcase the stone’s features. Colours may vary slightly depending on lighting and screen settings.

category-description: Peridot, also known as olivine, is a vibrant green gemstone formed deep within the Earth’s mantle and prized for its distinctive lime-green hue.
product-description:
Natural Peridot

Peridot, the gem-quality variety of the mineral olivine, is prized for its vivid green colour that ranges from yellow-green to olive, depending on its iron content. Unlike many other green gemstones, peridot's colour is intrinsic to the mineral itself rather than caused by trace impurities, giving it a distinctive and consistent hue. It forms deep within the Earth’s mantle and is brought to the surface through volcanic activity, making it a true geological marvel.

Olivine is also famously found in 'olivine bombs'—rounded or angular volcanic rocks that contain visible green olivine crystals embedded in a darker matrix of basalt or scoria. These geological formations are a striking example of the mineral’s origin in volcanic processes and are sought after by collectors for their dramatic contrast and natural beauty.

Ancient cultures revered peridot as a stone of protection and prosperity. It has been found in Egyptian jewellery dating back over 3,000 years and was once mistaken for emerald in medieval times. Today, peridot remains a popular choice among collectors and lapidaries for its relative hardness, bright colour, and crisp, clean crystal structure.

Each peridot specimen offers a glimpse into Earth's fiery interior. Whether presented as a facetable rough, crystal cluster, or matrix specimen, peridot is both an aesthetic and mineralogical delight—ideal for those who appreciate naturally occurring beauty formed under intense pressure and heat.

PropertyValue
Chemical Formula(Mg,Fe)2SiO4
Mohs Hardness6.5 - 7
Refractive Index (RI)1.65 - 1.69
OriginMount Shadwell, Victoria

Disclaimer:

Due to the natural origin of each stone, expect some variations in colour, shape, and inclusions. Please note that photos are taken under lighting conditions that best showcase the stone’s features. Colours may vary slightly depending on lighting and screen settings.

category-description: Ready to dig in? Our sapphire-rich washbags bring the thrill of fossicking straight to you — just add water and start your treasure hunt.
product-description:
Sapphire Fossicking Wash Bags

Our sapphire wash bags bring the fun of fossicking right to your home or field trip. Each bag contains sapphire-bearing gravels sourced from known deposits, offering a chance to uncover natural stones through sieving and sorting. Perfect for hobbyists, families, and aspiring gem hunters alike!

ContentsDetails
MaterialGravel with natural sapphires
WeightVaries (typically 1–2kg)
LocationAustralia (QLD/NSW)

Disclaimer:

Sapphires vary in size and abundance per bag. While all bags contain natural material, we cannot guarantee the quantity or quality of stones found. For best results, use proper sieving and sorting techniques.

category-description: Can't decide? Let us surprise you! Our mystery boxes are packed with a random assortment of rough, polished, and unusual gems and minerals — always fun, never the same.
product-description:
Mystery Boxes

Our mystery boxes are perfect for collectors, hobbyists, and lapidary lovers who enjoy a surprise. Each box includes a variety of specimens – from rough gemstones and mineral samples to synthetic pieces and potential cutting material. A fun and educational way to build your collection or explore new materials.

ContentsDetails
MaterialMixed (natural and synthetic)
TypesGem rough, minerals, faceting material
WeightVaries

Disclaimer:

No two boxes are the same. Items are chosen at random from available stock. All materials are as-described and unprocessed unless otherwise noted. No returns based on contents.

category-description: Each thunder egg holds a surprise within — crack them open to reveal vibrant patterns, hidden crystals, and natural beauty formed over millions of years.
product-description:
Thunder Eggs

Thunder eggs are unique geological formations that often contain stunning agate or quartz centres, hidden inside unassuming nodules. Each one is a surprise, with no two alike. Popular with collectors and cutters alike, thunder eggs can reveal intricate patterns and vivid colours when sliced and polished.

PropertyValue
CompositionSilica-rich (Agate, Chalcedony, Quartz)
Hardness6.5 – 7
FormationVolcanic nodules with cavity infill

Disclaimer:

Due to the natural origin of each stone, expect some variations in colour, shape, and inclusions. Please note that photos are taken under lighting conditions that best showcase the stone’s features. Colours may vary slightly depending on lighting and screen settings.
